data.title: CCC10K
data.meta_description: April 19, 2025 Days Hours Min Sec Register Now THE RACE FOR ALL Y’ALL Register Now Training Guide Since 1979, the Crescent City Classic 10k has been a New Orleans tradition. The race, which takes place every year on the Saturday before Easter Sunday, is produced locally by the Crescent City Classic Foundation,  a not-for-profit […]
data.text:
CORRALS AND ESTIMATED FINISHING TIMES:

SEEDED CORRALS: (REQUIRE VERIFICATION TO REGISTER)

Brown/AUnder 35 minutesPink/B35:01-40:00 minGray/C40:01-45:00 minGreen/D45:01-55:00 min

NON-SEEDED CORRALS:

Red/E55:01-1:04:59RUNBlue/F1:05:00-1:14:59JOGPurple/G1:15:00-1:29:59JOG/RACING STROLLERSYellow/H1:30:00-2:00:00WALK/STROLLERS/WAGONSOrange/IALL CHARITY PARTICIPANTS

*RACING STROLLERS ONLY will be allowed to enter Purple/G corral. ALL OTHER STROLLERS must start in Yellow/H corral.

RACE DAY CORRAL INSTRUCTIONS:

The race begins near the NOLA Superdome on Poydras St., near Loyola Ave., in Downtown New Orleans. The Seeded corrals will start promptly at 8:00AM. Other corrals will follow with start times in 3-5-minute intervals.

Seeded A-C & Corral I/Charity will access their corrals via Lasalle.

Corrals D-G will access corral by going to the Plaza Level of the Superdome and down the ramp at Gate A.

Corral H will line up on Sugar Bowl Dr. by the Superdome.

CHIP TIMING:

Finishing times in Results are based on when your chipped race bib crosses the start line, not the 8:00AM start time. Chip time will be used for official results.

Free Bus Transportation

At 5:30 am, buses will begin transporting participants who parked near the finish to the start of the race, picking up in City Park at Beau Bassich Circle (near Tad Gormley Stadium).

Buses will bring participants to Champions Square, near the start of the race.

PLEASE ARRIVE BEFORE 7:15 am to catch the last buses to the start.

After the race, buses will return race participants who parked near the start back downtown from 9:30 am until 1:00 pm. The buses will pick up on Henry Thomas Dr., on the backside of the Festival Grounds.

Shuttle Buses are complimentary to all runners. Please have your race bib available. Transportation for non-participants is not guaranteed.

Parking near the Start

Garage 5 at the Caesar’s Superdome

will be open and accessible from the I-10 Poydras/Superdome exit.

parking: $15. NO CASH. Debit or credit card only.

Poydras Parking Garage 1301 Girod Street:

$8 for up to six hours.

Accessible from Loyola Ave. Open 24/7.

Parking near the Finish

Free parking is available, but limited along Victory and Dreyfous as as Victory Drive.

NO parking on the following streets you will be ticketed.

No parking in Marconi Drive bike lanes.

No parking on grass in City Park.

Group/Charter bus parking must park in Tad Gormley stadium via Marconi by 7:00 am.

SEEDED RUNNERS

Runners wanting to start in a seeded corral (Corrals A, B, C and D) must provide proof of a finishing time of under 55:00 minutes in the 2024 CCC10K or on a certified 10K course in the last calendar year

Brown/A Seeded Corral: Under 35 minutes

Pink/B Seeded Corral: 35:01-40:00 min

Gray/C Seeded Corral: 40:01-45:00 min

Green/D Seeded Corral: 45:01-55:00 min

Additional finishing times that will be accepted:

1. 2024 Corporate Classic 5K

Brown/A Seeded Corral: Under 17:30 minutes (35 min 10K)

Pink/B Seeded Corral: 17:31-20:00 min (40 min 10K)

Gray/C Seeded Corral: 20:01-22:30 min (45 min 10K)

Green/D Seeded Corral: 22:31-27:00 min (55 min 10K)

2. 2025 St Patrick’s Day Classic 2-Mile Run

Brown/A Seeded Corral: under 10:50 min (35:00 10k)

Pink/B Seeded Corral: 10:51-12:25 min (40:00 10k)

Gray/C Seeded Corral: 12:26-14:00 min (45:00 10k)

Green/D Seeded Corral: 14:01-16:00 min (55:00 10k)

To register online as a Seeded Runner:

1. Seeded Runners (those who will finish in under 55:00) should enter their finishing time in the Estimated Finishing Time box when registering.

2. Next, you will be asked to provide a URL for your qualifying results. All qualifying results should be from a race with a certified course in the previous calendar year.

*All qualifying times are subject to review and verification. If you do not provide a URL, you cannot start in a seeded corral.

*Seeded runners who provide a sub-55 min finishing time, and are accepted, will be assigned to groups A, B, C or D based on their time. Seeded runners will line up in the first four corrals on Race Day allowing them a clean start.

CCC10K AWARDS:

Top Finisher Awards: Finishers from the following categories receive prize money and free entry to next year’s race.

Open: Top 5 Male and Top 5 Female Finishers

-First Place Male and Female – $500 + commemorative award.

-Second Place Male and Female – $300 + commemorative award.

-Third Place Male and Female – $200 + commemorative award.

-Fourth Place Male and Female – $100

-Fifth Place Male and Female – $50

– Master (40+): First Place Male and Female – $100

– Grandmaster (50+): First Place Male and Female – $100

– Senior (60+): First Place Male and Female – $100

Age Group Awards: 14 & Under, 15-19, 20-24, 25-29, 30-34, 35-39, 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69, 70-74, 75-79, 80+

– First place male and female finishers receive free registration in next year’s event.

– Top three male and female finishers receive limited edition prizes.

*No hotel or travel expenses paid.

TOP 500 WINNERS: We are proud to present our Top 500 Men/Top 500 Women with this year’s CCC10K Poster.

Top 500 winners can pick up posters at the Michelob Ultra Race Fest or beginning teh Friday following the event at Louisiana Running + Walking Co located at 4153 Canal St NOLA 70119.

Family Fun Zone

There’s something for everyone at the Michelob Ultra RaceFest, even kids! Children 10 years and younger can enter the RaceFest for free, and enjoy the kid-friendly activities in the Raising Cane’s Family Fun Zone! Kids will love the interactive games, inflatables, obstacle courses and much more. The Crescent City Classic and Raising Cane’s are dedicated to getting more kids and families outside and active together! Whether it is to run, walk or just come join the festivities after the race, we encourage you to bring the entire family and make the Classic an Easter weekend tradition.

Sponsored By:

FAQ’s

My family would like to meet me after the race, how do they find me and get into the Michelob Ultra RaceFest?

Family members or friends who are not participating in the race can meet you inside the Michelob Ultra RaceFest. Fest tickets can be purchased during registration, at the Expo or at Reunion Shelter at the entrance to the Festival Grounds for $20/$25 on race day. Once inside, there will be alphabetical letter signs hanging on a fence inside the RaceFest, where you can find them once you finish the race. MAPS FOR SPECTATORS ARE SEND BEFORE RACE DAY IN THE

I had my race number mailed to me, can I pick up my t-shirt at the RaceFest?

Yes, go to the T-Shirt Tent inside the Race Fest. Be sure to have your race bib with attached t-shirt tab.

A large group of us are participating, can we bring a tent to use as a meeting spot?

Tents are allowed in our Private Party Tent Village section of the RaceFest, but there is a $150 non-refundable site-fee and all tents must be set up on the Friday before the race (no tents will be allowed in on Race Day). To reserve your spot, CLICK HERE.

Can we bring in our own food or drinks?

Food and other beverages are only allowed if you purchase a tent in the Private Party Tent Village. All food/on-site cooking must be approved by the CCC prior to the event, and must stay within your assigned tent space.
